title: Apple Pencil 2: Latest news and rumours about Apple's new 2018 stylus
description:
![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**For the vast majority of mobile tasks, a touchscreen and your fingers are
all you need. But when it comes to proper creative work, you can’t beat the
precision offered by a dedicated stylus — and the[Apple
Pencil](https://www.trustedreviews.com/opinion/apple-pencil-vs-wacom-vs-
surface-pen-vs-s-pen-2928575) is Apple’s offering to artists. **

Is the Apple Pencil starting to look a little old in 2018? First released in
2015, the hardware is almost two-and-a-half years old now, and predates newer
Apple technologies like [Face ID](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/what-is-
face-id-3286453).

The time is therefore ripe for Apple to launch a follow-up – we’ll call it the
Apple Pencil 2 – so we’ve collected together all of the latest leaks and
rumours to try and work out what the tech giant has planned. Here’s everything
we think we know, including the Apple Pencil 2 release date, price, and hints
and the new features we might see.

Shall we begin?

**Related:[WWDC 2018](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/wwdc-2018-dates-
rumors-news-3399519)**

## Apple Pencil 2 release date and price

Although Apple is yet to announce the Apple Pencil 2, at present the most
likely dates for its reveal are June, or September in 2018. Apple likes to
announce its products with a release following pretty quickly afterwards,
usually within a month or so.

Our initial prediction was for a March announcement at an [education-focussed
event](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/apple-event-
march-2018-launch-3433358) that Apple held on March 27. As well as the hand-
drawn look of the event’s logo, rumours pointed towards there being some kind
of Apple Pencil announcement coming out of the event alongside the event’s
[new 2018 iPads.](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/new-ipad-2018-release-
date-specs-price-rumours-leaks-3423309)

However, in the end all we got was the announcement that the existing Apple
Pencil would work on the new iPad.

That means that at this point a WWDC or even a September reveal alongside the
[iPhone 9](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/iphone-9-release-date-specs-
features-price-rumours-uk-3297160) are now the main options for Apple Pencil
2’s reveal — if its coming in 2018 at all.

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-

## Apple Pencil 2 rumoured features

With the new Apple Pencil yet to see an official announcement, details are
currently thin on the ground as to what direction Apple might want to take the
hardware in. Most of what we have to go on currently are patents, which are a
vague indication at best.

The firmest (yet probably least exciting) rumour doing the rounds is that the
new Pencil will be [equipped
with](https://www.letemsvetemapplem.eu/2017/01/18/apple-pencil-2-prvni-
informace-patent/) some kind of physical or magnetic clip for more easily
attaching it to an iPad.

However, we’re more excited by the prospect of the Pencil’s tip getting a
redesign. The rumour comes courtesy of [a
patent](http://www.google.com/patents/US9329703) that suggests interchangeable
nibs might allow artists to pick a size and shape of nib that works best for
them.

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

Combine this with [rumours](http://www.patentlyapple.com/patently-
apple/2017/02/apple-wins-patent-for-next-gen-force-sensors-for-apple-pencil-
that-could-control-zoom-scrolling-and-more.html) that the new Pencil might be
force sensitive (much as every iPhone since the 6S has been), and it’s
starting to sound like the Apple Pencil 2 might more closely resemble the
styluses that typically accompany dedicated creative pro tablets.

Other patents have also [hinted that](http://www.google.com/patents/US9329703)
the end of the Pencil 2 might be equipped with an eraser to easily scrub out
any mistakes.

Finally, and perhaps most intriguingly, are
[rumours](http://www.patentlyapple.com/patently-apple/2018/02/apple-patent-
reveals-advancing-apple-pencil-to-work-with-non-touch-surfaces-and-
supporting-3d-ar-editing-apps.html) that the Apple Pencil 2 might be equipped
with technology to allow it to write on any surface — rather than just a
touchscreen. This functionality would not only be helpful for using the iPad
on a desk, but could also allow the Pencil 2 to be used like a mouse to
control a Mac.

## Apple Pencil 2: What we want to see

The biggest omission from any of these rumours has been any mention of a
spring-loaded tip.

The Apple Pencil is a solid piece of plastic, so actually drawing with it can
sometimes feel like using a crayon rather than a pen. Competing styluses from
Wacom get around this problem by having a nib with a spring in it which flexes
as you press on the screen, leading to a much more natural feeling drawing
experience.

We’d also really like to see the Pencil equipped with a side button for
enabling shortcuts — be that changing colours or drawing modes. Again, this is
something that’s fairly common with other styluses.

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

Finally, we’d just like to see the Apple Pencil 2 be made more ergonomic. Past
Apple products such as the
[AirPods](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/airpods) have done a great
job at combining ergonomics with the trademark sleek Apple design, but we
think the original Apple Pencil leans far too much towards the latter.

It ends up meaning that the Pencil is uncomfortable to use for drawing over
longer periods. We’d love a slightly thicker pencil, perhaps with a little
rubber to cushion the fingers.
